info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 2 at 7:05PM EDT by NWS Jackson KY
info.description:
At 705 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Mize to Wonnie to Stringtown to Dotson. Movement was northeast at 45 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible.
Locations impacted include... Pilgrim, Moon, Oaklawn Estates, Florress, Davella, Lick Branch, Falcon, Whitehouse, Wonnie, Burning Fork, Collista, West Van Lear, Panama, Williamsport, Milo, Gillem Branch, Redbush, Relief, Swamp Branch, and Ever.
THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Bert T. Combs Mountain Parkway between mile markers 75 and 76. Kentucky Highway 3 in Floyd County between mile markers 1 and 4. Kentucky Highway 3 in Johnson County Kentucky Highway 3 in Martin County between mile markers 1 and 9. U.S. Highway 23 in Floyd County between mile markers 16 and 21. U.S. Highway 23 in Johnson County between mile markers 0 and 16.
info.instruction:
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for southeastern, northeastern and east central Kentucky.

parameter.value: STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT MARTIN...CENTRAL MORGAN... JOHNSON...NORTHWESTERN FLOYD...NORTHERN MAGOFFIN AND SOUTHEASTERN ELLIOTT COUNTIES THROUGH 745 PM EDT

area.areaDesc: Elliott; Morgan; Johnson; Magoffin; Floyd; Martin
